I urge all Members to vote for American workers and businesses and support the reauthorization of the @ExImBankUS today.
The @ExImBankUS reauthorization enjoys strong support from labor and the business community, including @USChamber, @MachinistsUnion, and @ShopFloorNAM.

Today’s bill will help ensure @ExImBankUS can continue to support job creation by: 
- Reauthorizing the agency for 10 years,
- Increasing the agency’s lending capacity,
- Ensuring the agency can continue to finance large projects even if the Senate fails to confirm Board members.
The @ExImBankUS is a good deal for American taxpayers. Over the past 10 years, the agency has generated more than $3.4 billion in deficit reduction.
In Fiscal Year 2018, 90% of @ExImBankUS authorizations directly supported small businesses, including 315 small businesses that used the agency for the first time.
Over the last ten years, @ExImBankUS has financed more than $255.2 billion in U.S. exports and supported 1.6 million U.S. jobs in all 50 states at no cost to American taxpayers.

The @ExImBankUS has been a major success story in countering aggressive foreign export credit agencies, including three in China alone, that finance exports from the global competitors of American businesses.

Today, the House will vote to reauthorize @ExImBankUS, which plays a critical role in helping businesses in the U.S. maintain a strong, competitive presence in the global economy. https://bit.ly/2NTfQNf

10. Why doesn’t the budget include investments to assist small businesses that have been endangered by President Trump’s economic policies?  #TrumpBudget

9. In light of dangerous weather events across the country, including deadly tornadoes in Alabama, why does the budget cut funding levels for #climatechange and protections for clean air and water from the @EPA? #TrumpBudget

8. Do Republicans have any real plan or detail as to how they plan to spend the $200 billion the Admin has requested for #infrastructure? Will they follow their previous proposal that was rejected out of hand by Dems & Republicans for lack of detail or seriousness? #TrumpBudget

7. How can Republicans seriously propose using the overseas contingency operations account (OCO) to boost defense funding at the risk of non-defense funding when even Mick Mulvaney has called OCO a “slush fund and gimmick?” #TrumpBudget

6. Why would Republicans extend tax cuts for the wealthy in the #GOPtaxscam when the facts show that the law only enriched investors and hasn’t resulted in the job creation or economic growth that the Administration promised? #TrumpBudget
5. Given the trillion dollar deficits projected for four straight years in this budget, will Republicans admit that tax cuts do NOT pay for themselves? #TrumpBudget

4. Are Republicans prepared to admit they are NOT the party of fiscal responsibility, because the budget doesn’t balance for at least 15 years – breaking President Trump’s campaign promise to balance the budget within eight years? #TrumpBudget

3. After the American people resoundingly rejected Republican efforts to undermine the Affordable Care Act in the last election, why would the Administration propose repealing the #ACA once again? #TrumpBudget
2. How will Republicans explain to seniors that they want to cut $845 billion from #Medicare? #TrumpBudget

1. How can Republicans justify an $8.6 billion request to fund a border wall that Congress just rejected and that President Trump’s former chief of staff John Kelly recently said would be “a waste of money?” #TrumpBudget

The House will pass the #RaiseTheWage Act today to give up to 33 million workers a well-deserved pay raise. RT if you agree @senatemajldr should take up this bill, pass it, and sent it to @POTUS’s desk. pic.twitter.com/Kdcan3StET

It’s time to #RaiseTheWage for women and families in #MD05 and across the country. Over 20 million women will benefit from the #RaisetheWage Act, especially women of color who make up 40% of the workforce and face higher rates of wage discrimination.

I brought the last minimum wage increase to the House Floor for a vote, and I’m proud the House will pass the #RaiseTheWage Act today to gradually increase the federal minimum wage to $15/hour. Action is long overdue. I urge @HouseGOP to join us in supporting this bill. pic.twitter.com/Wa1ZlxrLb6

Too many families across the country are working hard, but struggling to make ends meet. That’s why the House will pass the #RaisetheWage Act today to gradually raise the federal minimum wage and lift 1.3 million Americans out of poverty, including 600,000 children. pic.twitter.com/qRiNe6E638

Shakiera Pearson from Brandywine told me before her current job as a trained construction craft laborer, she worked minimum wage jobs to support her 4 kids. She knows what it’s like to worry about making ends meet & wants Congress to #RaiseTheWage to help families like hers. pic.twitter.com/vydiQczoIv

Victor Reyes of Berwyn Heights has a union construction job. He started his career as a non-union day-laborer and told me that he wants Congress to pass the #RaiseTheWage Act so that the individuals he works with can have the same economic security he has now.

Families throughout #MD05 will benefit from the #RaiseTheWage Act. Delano Alexander from Clinton is an environmental services aide at Prince George’s Hospital Center making $12.85 an hour. Increasing the minimum wage to $15 will help him and his family get ahead.

The #RaiseTheWage Act will help thousands of Marylanders like Dana Hudson from Owings. Dana works at Safeway to supplement his income as a farmer and help pay for medical expenses for his wife. A higher minimum wage would give Dana and his family more financial stability. pic.twitter.com/eW5Ych6HjI

I’m voting for the #RaisetheWage Act to give nearly 81,000 workers in #MD05 a long-overdue pay raise. Marylanders across our state are working hard to make ends meet and deserve to earn a wage that will allow them to get ahead.

I am proud to bring the #RaiseTheWage Act to the House Floor today to give up to 33 million workers a raise. House Dems are working #ForThePeople and taking steps to ensure more families can get ahead. RT if you agree it’s time to raise the wage. pic.twitter.com/f326lV9I9V
